Package abalone

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • abalone.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The game class, keeps track of the game and can move marble Created on 17-01-2019.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sam Freriks and Ayla van der Wal.

      • Game

        public Game​(int amountplayers,
            AbaloneServer srv,
            java.lang.String player1Name,
            java.lang.String player2Name)
        Constructor of the game, make a new game with the number of players, server, names of the players.
        Parameters:
        amountplayers - the amount of players
        srv - the server connected to this game
        player1Name - name of the first player
        player2Name - name of the second player
        Ensures
        the set the parameter accordingly

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        calls the reset method on the board object.
        Ensures
        that the board will reset

      • checkScore

        public void checkScore()
                throws BoardException,
                       java.io.IOException,
                       ClientUnavailableException
        checks if a player /team has reached the score limit, if it is reached, the game finished message will be send. to all the player.
        Throws:
        BoardException - exception if the board encounters an error
        java.io.IOException - exception if the IO encounters an error
        ClientUnavailableException - Exception if the client is not available

      • addMove

        public void addMove​(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String direction,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    ClientUnavailableException,
                    BoardException,
                    IllegalMoveException
        Will check if the player is on turn and check if the move is valid, will move if both true.
        Parameters:
        name - of the players
        direction - direction of the wanted move
        indexes - of all the marbles moving
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if the IO gets an error.
        ClientUnavailableException - exception if the client is not available
        BoardException - exception is there is an error on the board
        IllegalMoveException - throws exception if the move is not legal

      • getNextPlayer

        public java.lang.String getNextPlayer()
        return next player, the order made in the constructor is kept.
        Returns:
        the name of the players that is next in turn.

      • getPlayers

        public java.lang.String[] getPlayers()
        get all players in this game.
        Returns:
        an array with all the players connected to this game
